refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: vspx_buttonScriptable version of Submit Button of the HTML form. Depending of 'action' attribute it may have variants. In some of these variants button will not have submit function (as select and browse button), so in that case they will perform special function for selecting or pop up of new window.

refsect2.title: name
refsect2.para: A unique name identifying the control.

refsect2.title: annotation
refsect2.para: A human readable comment.

refsect2.title: initial-enable
refsect2.para: Designates is control visible or not initially. Could be data-bound to an SQL expression.

refsect2.title: action
refsect2.para: This designate subclassing of the button.
'simple' : is a simple submit button, no special functions
'submit' : an alias of 'simple' button, obsolete

'delete' : a button for deleting a row in a data-set or data-grid controls, it is represented as a submit button with special on-post script. The delete function is performed based on table, key attributes. (check implementation!!)
'browse' : a button for browsing will be originated, the function of it is to pop-up a window as specified in selector attribute. Designate client-side JavaScript generation.

'return' : this button type will return a value of fileds named as specified in it's children 'filed' elements to the parent window. The page rendering class will make client-side JavaScript code for serving it's function.
'logout' : can appear only in login control, this is to perform logout function of it.

refsect2.title: value
refsect2.para: Text of the label of the button.

refsect2.title: child-window-options
refsect2.para: Options for opening a child pop-up window.This can be used only with conjuction of action browse.

refsect2.title: browser-current
refsect2.para: Current directory of browsing. Can be used only with browse button for WebDAV or Filesystem resources.

refsect2.title: browser-filter
refsect2.para: Filter expression(s) for browsing. (see above)

refsect2.title: browser-list
refsect2.para: Type of browser list, 0 - short, 1 - long

refsect2.title: browser-mode
refsect2.para: COL, RES or STANDALONE , this is to specify what to be selected. In other words this affects behaviour of the pop-up window.

refsect2.title: browser-type
refsect2.para: This designate type of browser: dav or os (filesystem).

refsect2.title: browser-xfer
refsect2.para: A way of transferring the data between windows, DOM is default. No other options in current implementation.

refsect2.title: style
refsect2.para: A style of button, affects appearance.
'submit' : This is a default style used, no special handling. The button will be rendered as usual submit button.
'uri' : The button will be rendered as link, furthermore client side JavaScript code will be produced to act as like submit button.
'image' : The button will be rendered as image on browser under link button. In that case value of button control must be link to the image file.

refsect2.title: selected-image
refsect2.para: An alternate image

refsect2.title: not-selected-image
refsect2.para: A second alternate image. This and above can will be only initialized. One can use them to change simultaneously the value of button (i.e. ufl_value and hance rendering).

refsect2.title: selector
refsect2.para: This is a URL to pop-up windows. Note that it can be used only with browse button.

refsect2.title: field
refsect2.para: This element may occur under browse button or select button, it enumerates the names of inputs to be sent to/back between pop-up and parent window.

example.title: Simple example
example.screen: <v:button name="submit1" action="simple" style="image" xhtml:alt="A test button" value="--'plus.gif'" />
